item.title: ItemOnObject [639]
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I have already tried ItemOnItem and “nothing interesting happens”
I accually think its my compiler because I accually removed the
11286(Visage) and 1540(anti-dragon shield) and got no errors
and I could still make the Dragonfire shield

My compiler is only compiling certain java files.
I don’t know how

@echo off echo Compiling RS2Server... "C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.7.0/bin/javac.exe" -d bin -cp lib/*; -sourcepath src src/org/dementhium/*.java echo Complete pause

And the ItemOnItemHandler.java and ItemOnObjectHandler.java are in this directory

IT SHOULD BE COMPILING!

Read full topic

item.title: ItemOnObject [639]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Because you are sending dialogue when you use that item on an anvil? Maybe trying to add items instead. The 0 in the Dialogue thing may mean a null in dialogue, meaning it is sending nothing.

This is so wrong…

I’m pretty sure he’s trying to use an Anvil (Object) with an Item, not two items used together…
[/quote]
dude he is talking about item on item i believe because you dont mantle a godsword using an anvil you use the shards together so its item on item to make an item[/quote]

Then why oh so smart one, did he attempt to put Anvil in his code, and why would he ask for itemonobject help.

item.title: ItemOnObject [639]
item.dc:creator: @Ecstacy_Pkz Ecstacy Pkz
item.description:
@Ecstacy_Pkz wrote:

This is so wrong…

You don’t do ItemOnObject, It’s ItemOnItem.

Open up your ItemOnItem Class and search for:

if (itemUsed == 985 && itemUsedWith == 987 || itemUsed == 987 && itemUsedWith == 985) { player.getInventory().getContainer().remove(new Item(985, 1)); player.getInventory().getContainer().remove(new Item(987, 1)); player.getInventory().addItem(989, 1); player.sendMessage("You join the two halves of the key together"); return; }

Under that add this:

else if (itemUsed == GODSWORD ID && itemUsedWith == HILT ID) { player.getInventory().getContainer().remove(new Item(GODSWORD ID, 1)); player.getInventory().getContainer().remove(new Item(HILT ID, 1)); player.getInventory().addItem(FINISHED GODSWORD ID, 1); player.sendMessage("You attach the hilt to the godsword."); return; }

Read full topic

item.title: ItemOnObject [639]
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Ok so I have been trying to add godsword making to Eclipse 639
and here is what I’m putting in ItemOnObjectHanlder.java under

protected void doObjectAction(Player player, Message packet, GameObject object, int itemUsed, int objX, int objY, int objId, CacheObjectDefinition definition) { ActionSender.sendCloseChatBox(player); String name = definition.getName().toLowerCase(); if (player.getActivity().itemAction(player, new Item(itemUsed, 1), 0, "ItemOnObject", object)) { return; } CacheObjectDefinition def = object.getDefinition();

if (def.getName().toLowerCase().contains("anvil")) { if (itemUsed == 11690 || itemUsed == 11702) { DialogueManager.sendDialogue(player, 0); return;

But I compile (no errors)
and restart the server and it says nothing interesting happens.
But I haven’t really gotten any errors on my compiler…
So I go into ItemOnObjectHanlder.java and just put a few brackets that aren’t suposed to be there and I compile and I get no errors?
Thats weird because the file in in the folders where the compile is compiling.
What do you think the problem is?
Can someone help?

[size=13pt]NO ONE EVER HELPS ME WITH MY PROBLEMS! WTF[/size]

Read full topic
